summary: An ordinance amending Section 5 of Ordinance No. 21593, entitled: "An ordinance providing for the protection of the public along or across railroad lines on streets, public highways, and places or properties open to the public within the City of Seattle, requiring fences, barriers, gates, lights, and flagmen, and prescribing penalties for the violation of the same", approved August 6, 1909, as amended by Ordinance No. 34255, entitled: "An ordinance amending Section 5 of Ordinance No. 21593 entitled: \`An ordinance providing for the protection of the public along and across railroad lines on streets, public highways, and places or properties open to the public within the City of Seattle, requiring fences, barriers, gates, lights, and flagmen, and prescribing penalties for the violation of the same'", approved February 4, 1915.
